questionListItems.title: How do I claim or retrieve my household's CDC Vouchers? Do I need to re-claim the vouchers ?

answer.body:
Yes. Claiming process remains the same as past years' CDC Vouchers. Only one member representing the household needs to make the claim digitally via Singpass at go.gov.sg/cdcv.


  1. Visit go.gov.sg/cdcv , select CDC Vouchers 2024 and login with Singpass to claim your vouchers.

  2. You may also use go.gov.sg/cdcv to retrieve your previous voucher link by logging in to Singpass again.

  3. The voucher link will be sent via SMS, that will contain both the CDC Vouchers for using at participating heartland merchants and hawkers, and at participating supermarkets. These vouchers can be used till 31 December 2024. You can refer to the step-by-step infographics or the notification letter on how to claim and spend the $500 CDC Vouchers:


How to claim your CDC Vouchers 2024


  1. Visit go.gov.sg/cdcv and tap on CDC Vouchers 2024.



  2. Log in with Singpass. Only one household member needs to do this on behalf of the household.




  3. Receive your CDC Voucher link by SMS. Forward the SMS to share vouchers with household members.





How to spend your CDC Vouchers 2024


  1. Select which CDC Vouchers you want to use.



  2. Choose the amount to spend. Then tap ‘Show voucher’.



  3. Show the QR code to the shop staff. They will scan it to complete your payment.



*Visuals shown are for illustrative purposes only.



If you do not have a smartphone or Singpass, or for further enquiries or assistance, visit your nearest Community Centre/Club (CC) or call the PA Contact Centre at 6225 5322.


Hotline operating hours:

Monday to Sunday

8am - 6pm

New Year's Eve, Chinese New Year's Eve, and Christmas Eve

8am - 1pm

Public Holidays

Closed

questionListItems.title: How do I find out the value left for my CDC vouchers?

answer.body: You may access your voucher link found in the SMS sent by RedeemSG to find out the remaining balance of your CDC Vouchers. The value is shown on the respective tabs.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if I lose my PAssion Silver Concession card/PAssion Silver card (non-concession)?

answer.body:
For PAssion Silver Concession Card:


You can apply for a replacement for your lost card via:

  • Online

    • TransitLink website at www.transitlink.com.sg/lost-card-replacement

    • TransitLink SimplyGo mobile app (Download links for: Apple App Store  | Google Play)

    • TransitLink Kiosk

  • In Person

    • Visit any SimplyGo Ticketing Service Centre with your original NRIC and a colour passport-sized photograph (non-returnable) that was taken within the last 3 months against a white background. Anyone helping you to apply for a replacement would have to present his or her own original NRIC/Passport in addition to the above-mentioned items.

Please note that a replacement fee of $16.10/$15.10* is applicable.

*Enjoy discounted administrative fee when you apply for your replacement at Self Service Channels such as online, mobile app and SimplyGo Kiosk


A lost card report will be filed automatically once you replace your concession card. For security reasons, the loss report is irreversible once it is logged into the system.


The lost card will be deactivated and would no longer be usable even if found. TransitLink will refund the remaining travel value in your card after the lost card report has been filed. You will need to provide your mobile number to the SimplyGo Ticketing Service Centre, or input your mobile number when applying for the lost replacement via e-Service on the TransitLink website and TransitLink SimplyGo mobile app, to process the refund. You will receive a claim number via SMS to collect your refund at any SimplyGo Ticket Office after 7 working days. TransitLink will not be liable for any misuse before the lost card report is filed.


You will also have to inform the National Library Board (NLB) of the lost concession card to avoid any misuse. You may call NLB's helpdesk at 6332 3255. Your existing yuu Points will be transferred to the replacement card and you can continue earning yuu Points on the replacement card in about 5 working days upon the receipt of the card.


For PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession):

Please call PA Contact Centre Hotline at 6225 5322, which operates daily from 8am to 6pm (excluding public holidays), for assistance. Alternatively, you may get your lost PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) replaced at your nearest Community Club/Centre (CC). Please note that a replacement fee of $7.50 is applicable. The replacement card will be mailed to you in about 3 weeks.


You may also approach your nearest CC for assistance to file for a refund of the remaining travel value in your card after the loss report has been filed. Any remaining value will be refunded to you via bank transfer or to another adult ez-link card after 28 working days. Should there be any misuse before the card is cancelled, PA will not be liable to issue any refund.


You will also have to file a loss report with the National Library Board (NLB) to deactivate your card to prevent any misuse. You may call NLB's helpdesk at 6332 3255. Your existing yuu Points will be transferred to the replacement card and you can continue earning yuu Points on the replacement card in about 5 working days upon the receipt of the card.

questionListItems.title: Where can I top up my PAssion Silver Concession card/PAssion Silver card (non-concession)?

answer.body:
You can top up your PAssion Silver Concession Card/PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) via the following channels:


  • TransitLink Ticket Offices

  • Concession Card Replacement Offices

  • Passenger Service Centres at all Train Stations

  • TransitLink Kiosks

  • General Ticketing Machines

  • Top Up Machines

  • Add Value Machines

  • Top Up Terminals at Community Clubs (only credit or debit card payment accepted)

  • POSB/DBS and OCBC ATMs

  • Selected Locations, e.g. 7-11 and Cheers outlets


A minimum top up of $10 is required. A convenience fee per transaction may be applicable for some of the above top up modes. The maximum stored value of the PAssion Silver Concession Card/PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) is $500.

questionListItems.title: Why must I go to a TransitLink ticket office or concession card replacement office to activate my PAssion Silver Concession card? Why is the activation process not automatic?

answer.body: This is to prevent card abuse by having the card holder activate the PAssion Silver Concession Card personally. This is also a standard practice for the activation of all concession cards.

questionListItems.title: What is the difference between the current PAssion ez-link card and the new PAssion Silver Concession card/PAssion Silver card (non-concession)?

answer.body:
• Age - The PAssion Silver Concession Card/PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) is only for Singapore Citizens aged 60 and above. In comparison, anyone of any age can apply for the current PAssion Card.

  • Membership duration - PAssion Silver Concession Card/PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) holders enjoy a free 7-year membership, while current PAssion Card holders enjoy a 5-year paid membership subject to a membership fee.

  • Public transport fares - Both the PAssion Card and the PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) are adult ez-link cards whereas PAssion Silver Concession Card holders get to enjoy concessionary fares when travelling on public buses and train services.


For both card types, membership comes with privileges and benefits at Community Centres/ Clubs (CCs) and PA Outlets, as well as participating PAssion merchant outlets. PAssion Silver members can also get special discounts over and above these. The easy contactless payment function of the card also enables payment for:

  • CC and PAssion WaVe courses;

  • Transit services (e.g. MRT, LRT, Bus and Taxi);

  • Motoring charges (e.g. ERP charges, only for 2nd Generation IU);

  • Retail and services payment (e.g. 7-Eleven, NLB, etc); and

  • Earn yuu Points and enjoy amazing offers and rewards at over 1,000 places which include Cold Storage, CS Fresh, Guardian Health & Beauty, 7-Eleven, Giant, BreadTalk, Toast Box, Butter Bean, Food Junction, Food Republic, Food Opera, ThyeMoh Chan, Mandai Wildlife Reserve (home to Singapore's wildlife parks including Singapore Zoo, River Wonders, Night Safari and Jurong Bird Park) and Singtel.


They can also enjoy the following benefits:

  • Complimentary 5-year National Library Board (NLB) Partner Membership (Applicable to Singaporeans and PRs only); and

  • Exclusive privileges on eCapitaVoucher and deals on the CapitaStar App.


Below is a summary of the eligibility criteria and benefits of the listed cards:


Please refer to the PAssion Card website for the full list of privileges and benefits.

questionListItems.title: How do I activate my PAssion Silver Concession card?

answer.body: You will need to bring along your new PAssion Silver Concession Card and original NRIC, and visit any TransitLink Ticket Office or Concession Card Replacement Office to activate your card.

questionListItems.title: How do I renew my PAssion card membership?

answer.body:
You can renew your PAssion Card membership at the CC or online at www.onepa.gov.sg. You may renew as early as up to 24 months before the expiry date.


If you are holding a co-brand card, please approach the original card issuer. E.g. If you are holding a PAssion POSB Debit Card, please approach POSB.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if my PAssion card is damaged, lost or stolen?

answer.body:
Please call the PA Contact Centre at 6225 5322 (8am to 6pm, Mondays to Sundays, excluding Public Holidays) for assistance.


Gentle note on the following:

  • Step 1: Provide us your Name, NRIC/FIN/Passport No, Date of Birth, Contact and Address for verification and PA will liaise with EZ-Link Pte Ltd to de-activate your card from misuse.

(Note: De-activation is permanent and card cannot be reinstated for security purposes. It will take up to 48 hours from the time of reporting the lost card for the ez-link function to be blocked by EZ-Link Pte Ltd)

  • Step 2: Go to the nearest CC for us to assist you with a replacement card at $7.50

  • Step 3: Complete the 'EZ-recover application for PAssion EZ-Link Card' form available at the CC office if there is stored value* remaining in your card. (*EZ-Link Pte Ltd will process the refund within 28 working days upon the submission of the completed application form to CC office.)

  • Step 4: Email National Library Board (NLB) at enquiry@nlb.gov.sg to report loss of PAssion Card if you are a registered NLB user. Alternatively, you can drop by your nearest Community Club (CC) to report the loss of your PAssion Card and to file for any refund (at best efforts by EZ-Link Pte Ltd).

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for the PAssion Silver Concession card?

answer.body: For Singaporeans turning 60 years old, you will receive an invitation pack one month before your 60th birthday. You can submit your application online via the TransitLink website, via the TL SimplyGo mobile app (Download links for: Apple App Store  | Google Play), at TransitLink Ticket Offices or at Concession Card Replacement Offices. You can expect to receive the PAssion Silver Concession Card in approximately 2 to 4 weeks from the date of application. If your application is not received by the deadline indicated, a PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) will be issued and mailed to you instead.

questionListItems.title: Can I authorise someone to activate the new PAssion Silver Concession card on my behalf?

answer.body: Yes. The person helping you to activate your new PAssion Silver Concession Card will have to present his or her own original NRIC/Passport, together with your new PAssion Silver Concession Card and NRIC for verification.

questionListItems.title: What do I need to claim the vouchers?

answer.body:
You will require a valid Singpass account and smartphone to login and claim your vouchers. Singpass is needed to verify your identity and prevent fraudulent claims on behalf of your household.

Please refer to the step-by-step infographics on how to claim your household’s 2024 CDC vouchers or the notification letter:

How to claim your CDC Vouchers 2024


  1. Visit go.gov.sg/cdcv and tap on CDC Vouchers 2024.


  2. Log in with Singpass. Only one household member needs to do this on behalf of the household.



  3. Receive your CDC Voucher link by SMS. Forward the SMS to share vouchers with household members.



How to spend your CDC Vouchers 2024


  1. Select which CDC Vouchers you want to use.


  2. Choose the amount to spend. Then tap ‘Show voucher’.


  3. Show the QR code to the shop staff. They will scan it to complete your payment.


*Visuals shown are for illustrative purposes only.


If you do not have a smartphone or Singpass, or for further enquiries or assistance, visit your nearest Community Centre/Club (CC) or call the PA Contact Centre at 6225 5322.


Hotline operating hours:

Monday to Sunday

8am - 6pm

New Year's Eve, Chinese New Year's Eve, and Christmas Eve

8am - 1pm

Public Holidays

Closed

questionListItems.title: I have forgotten my Singpass Password

answer.body:
If you have set up your Singpass 2FA, you can reset your password instantly online:

  1. Visit Singpass Portal

  2. Select 'Services' on the top scroll bar

  3. Select 'Reset password'

  4. Enter your NRIC or FIN details, followed by Singpass Face Verification or SMS One-Time Password

  5. Create your new Singpass password


Alternatively, you may request for a PIN mailer to be sent to your registered address. You will receive your PIN mailer in 3 working days. You may choose to visit a Singpass counter located in all Community Centres/Clubs (CC) across Singapore for more assistance.

questionListItems.title: Who is eligible for the CDC Vouchers Scheme?

answer.body: Each Singaporean household can claim $500 in CDC Vouchers 2024. $250 can be spent at participating heartland merchants and hawkers, and the other $250 can be spent at participating supermarkets.

questionListItems.title: How do I/my household apply for the CDC Vouchers Scheme?

answer.body:
All Singaporean households will receive a notification letter on how to claim their CDC vouchers at go.gov.sg/cdcv.


Only one member representing the household needs to make the claim digitally via Singpass at go.gov.sg/cdcv.
